DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Colorectal Carcinoma Performed Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to the diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal of colorectal carcinomas are either polypoid or of the ulcerative -infiltrating type.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal of colorectal carcinomas are either polypoid or of the ulcerative -infiltrating type.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Grossly, most colorectal carcinomas are either polypoid or of the ulcerative -infiltrating type.  Adenocarcinoma is the most common carcinoma in the colon and rectum.  Colorectal adenocarcinoma can be divided in three grades: Grade I (low grade or well-di:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the colon or rectum and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to treatment or therapy.
